item.title: Vue 3
item.description: Preventing template from rendering: <style> [v-cloak] { display: none; /* Prevents {{}} from rendering until fully loaded */ } </style> <div id="app" v-cloak></div> Vue 3 setup in script: <script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@next"></script> <script> let app = Vue.createApp({ data() { return { } } }) app.mount("#app") <script> v-show vs v-if: v-show renders but sets display: none; while v-if doesn’t render at all. v-show is better if you are toggling a component frequently as it is more performant.
